headline.main: Problem of Outside Aid Is Regarded as Crucial After Battle of Kiev Pocket

lead_paragraph: FORT BENNING, Ga., Oct. 2 -- The battle of the Kiev pocket has made crucial the problem of aid to Russia. After more than three months of fighting the strategic situation in the Russian campaign is so much in the German favor that it now looks as if the Red Army cannot be maintained indefinitely as an effective fighting force without major materiel aid from outside Russia.
